values:
I enjoyed the Town Hall style given to the debate.

Lesse. I felt that the debate was over heavy on the War; by my estimation, about or over an hour of the two hour affair was dedicated to it. I think this hurt Edwards, whose main appeal is his very strong deomestic base. Even Cooper admited that they had gotten a huge amoun of submissions about the issue of health care, yet...5-7 minutes, and that's because a couple of the candidates cheated and slipped in their views when the question was immigration which got even less time.

Obama showed his inexperience, I felt, in the inconsistincy of his strength. On Foreign policy, for example, he was confident, well spoken, and mostly, I feel, right. However, in other areas he just simply wasn't well informed. 

Hillary may have been more direct, or whatever, but the thing is, her 'more direct' answers weren't to my taste, compared to the rest. Also, her idea that any democrat there would by virtue of being a democrat be beter than anyone else offended me, a bit.

Biden was good, and would make a great VP; but I could see him in the Presidency, too. I think he could back up a more inexperienced candidate, such as Obama or Edwards, very well.

Richardson hadn't much crossed my mind, but I did like his approach. I just don't think he's big enough.

Edwards is still my preference, though. His point on a personal seperation between faith beliefs and the ones put to paper were very much to my taste.

Kusinich's wife was pretty hot; But then, I have a thing for redheads.

<lj-cut TEXT=More Spoilers, and some self deprication, too> 

I'm a bit pissed at myself, for it taking to the second reading to catch how complete the Messiah parallels were.

Right down to the way that his dying for everyone protected them.

I mean...

</lj-cut>

<lj-cut text=Spoilers> 
I could swear that I'd read somethng about Lily Evans and Snape in the past. It might have just been a fanfic I'm remembering, but was there some hint of this in the series?

Also, I got a huge rush of deja-vous at the "NOT MY DAUGHTER, YOU BITCH!" Again, fanfic, or just craziness?

EDIT (first of many): Reading the bit about the cloak reenforces one of the many things which bothered me about the first movie; I thought the cloak behaved wrongly. It does look like one "imbued with a Disillusionment Charm," rather than one which truly makes the user utterly, undetectibly invisible.

Edit: The Doe thing also seems like an intensly farmiliar subject, to the point where I'm paranoidedly wondering if perhaps JKR wrote a fanfic plant or something to put these ideas out, or summat. I mean, really, I could swear it's soemthing I'd heard of, but can remember no metion of in the books.
</lj-cut>
Hemingway is believed to have purchased the weapon he used to commit suicide at Abercrombie & Fitch, which was then a firearm supplier

Ga Tech didn't give any money.
Well, ok, 2500. Tuition is 20000. Living, upwards of 10000. So, no money.
They did offer me a lto of loans. I think that would leave me, with what money I do have, with 85000 in debt, at the end of it all.
UCF for the win? I beleive so.
UF rejected me. Does make the decision easier now, though. Wow, though. Did not call that.

I was very angry about Children of Men's lack of wins, until the end.

The last three awards were perfect, just as they should have been.

Goodnight, all.

that The Pained Veil was going to be awesome?
I will see it tomorrow.
of stupid people making points by saying that 'correlation does not imply causation'.

Wow. If you haven't seen it, I highly recommend it.

EDIT: Obviously, I mean the original one.
I got into Ga Tech. Schweet!

So I'm generally tired, fair bored, and a touch depressed, which is frustrating and rather annoying. eukgh.

I'm almost legal.  w007. And my college essays are done. I have no words for how happy that makes me.

On the off chance that anyone I know (here) was planning on gifting me anything on my birthday, I have a list of culture I am missing.

Gross Pointe Blank
Fight Club.
The Princess Bride.
Anything by Kevin Smith (excepting Chasing Amy).

I plan to have all of these movies by college, but if anyone wants to help out.
No, having fufilled my greedy bastard quota for the day...
*disappears in puff of... **coughhack* aw, shit, this stuff*coughhackcoughhack*

I left someone a comment on (3v1l) myspace today, and this was above it: 

Warning - Please be aware that MySpace is accessed by thousands of users every day; since you do not know every user on the MySpace site, excercise caution when posting personally identifiable information.
I really need to start hitting the apps.

Wow...
That movie got SO fucked up at the end...

and it was so awesome.

That is to say, I just watched about half of the un-Special-Editioned Star Wars.

EDIT: Having now finished the movie...
Y'know, it was missing all of those neato cool '97 era special effects, and yet, it was still insanely awesome.

I can't say that my (well, it wasn't a crisis of faith, per se, but) whatever it was with my faith is over; not in the least, but...

Put it this way.

I'm wearing my chalice today, for the first time in months.

OH! And I really like a girl who likely has little or no such feelings of the same type for me, but
hey,
that's just par for the course for me, right?

I just saw the Rick James episode of Chappelle Show.
Gotta say...pretty good.

Springsteen is the Hemingway of musicians.
That seem to work?

Vhan: Hurricane w007!
Deuce: I just got my new keyboard. 
http://www.thinkgeek.com/computing/input/8396/
It is awesome, but as you can see...
Well, the point is my typos may be more frequent and I may typing more slowly online, so...
Just in case anyone happens to worry about it.

1 Today I helped the economy; WHOO! I got the vest I've been looking at ('ll bee here soon; it's awesome) and shoes. I haven't bought athletic shoes for two, prolly three years.

2 Bruce Springsteen...DAMN

3 For some reason, when I  was reading Anthem, my mental image of the "Golden One" (Ryands ultimate woman in this one) was Rebecca Fraily.

4 I mean, seriously, I got Born To Run about a month ago, and I still get chills when I listen to it.

5 I wrote a song today which FINALLY encapsulates well my feelings about a girl, so now I have to debate the morality of playing it; it's pretty personal; it's not like it names names or anything, just...

6 LIKE, HE'S THE FUCKING BOSS, MAN!

7 Vic is awesome. And l337.
 
8 Bridgit is pretty awesome, too.

9 FUCKIN' SPRINGSTEEN, MAN!

I think I may be becoming numb.
I don't know why, I don't even know for sure, but...
I just feel as if I no longer can feel. At least, romantically. 

Then, maybe it's just the inevitable loss of the whirlwind of seemingly random or indiscriminate feelings of pseudo-love that I've felt for GOd knows how long. Maybe because I didn't fall in love five times tonight, I just interpret it as numbness, in contrast.

*sigh* Maybe I'll be mroe lucid in the morning.

So much as I regret having a very limited social life, there is an upside: I end up having a higher concentration (I figure) of meaningful, or just good, conversation.
Woo.

was about seven types of awesome.
Indiana Jones; oooooooooooo.oh baby.
Crazy ass car show; oooooooh baby.
Actually, the 'ride of the movies' (I can't remember the name of the ride exactly) was pretty good.
Star Tours effectively caused me to truly realize the change which will be the lack of the Seniors leaving; in wondering the cannon-ical implications of the ride, I realized just how empty our senior class is of people who would find that even marginally interesting.
I also noticed just how much I think of friends. While I make something of a deal over how friendless I consider myself, I managed to filter almost everything I saw through my friends. I was at the park alone, yet when I watched the car show, I was wondering what Manhar would think of it of; with the Muppets, I was figuring how awesome of a Miss Piggy Christine would make, etc.
And then there's Fantasmic.
Fantasmic is Arielle on an acid trip.

US Hist: 3
Chem: 3
Eng Lang/Comp: 5 *snicker*
Stat: 4 (it's been said, but...*mad laughter*)

I got
a
4...
on Stat. 
I am currently laughing like a madman.
Really.
I love the stressed anti-corporate themes in the new big Disney movie...

This is kind of just an attempt to explain my current state of mind, and is certainly as much about me understanding as it is about any friends of mine. 
It's become increasingly clear to me that 'the plan,' what I had assumed to be my path,that which I had predicted to be my future, is not what is to be. I don't know that this is a bad thing, but it is a thing true. This leaves me an issue: my path. Basically, I look to change; to self improve. I'm looking into The Marines, and I see to add discipline to my life no matter; I seek to shape up, if nothing else.

And please, if you respect me in the least, and if you value my respect in turn, no comments of how I'm 'just fine the way that I am' or such. I'm not self-hating, I'm merely being self aware.

I'm planning on seeing the midnight showing of Pirates II, but I need a ride back after, because my parents are assholes.
Can anyone help?
Thank you quite much-ly if so.

EDIT: Sorry, I'll need a ride to it also. Thanks again, if anyone can.

it's a real bitch.

The difference?
It'll now be Hemingway I'm reading, not Donaldson.
I'm not sure of the spellings, and I dun have the patience to find me book, so...

I came to what may be an important (for me) realization today on the drive home, and I hope to all that it doesn't make me emo; unfortunately, it seems to perfectly fit (almost) into the definition I gave to someone on a comment a few days ago. 
There are two major sides to my personality; this is true on many levels, with many different aspects which fall into this duality. That's one of the major contributors, likely, to my rather firm observation of a tendency toward duality in all; but I digress. In this case, I refer to probably my most obvious dual nature; in basic demeanor. There is the side which I imagine most people associate with me; the hyperactive, unthinking-response, bloody well LOUD, always begging for attention me. Then there is the side of me which I think is less shown; something of an uber-introvert. I happen to be, as it turns out, extremely shy at times. This me is, as I said, shy, quiet, and tends to like sitting in corners.
Um, the reason for all this is that someone commented today that I seemed 'down,' though I'd guess that that has more to do with that, lesse...Vic is on vacation, out of contact, Bridg and Isabel, and, less new, Melissa, aren't at swing for reasons various, and I have almost no social contact at the moment, which means that my down me is somewhat more the dominant one right now, since it's the one oftener on.
Anyway, the point I was making; the realization to which I have come, is that I simply prefer the quieter me. Since that me is more depressive, or at least seems to be depressive, and since that's the person I prefer to be, that I want to be, that I'm prouder to be...
If you read Westley's comments, you may see my quandary about now.
The thing is that I don't think that the depressive bit is why I prefer that me; it's that that's the me who's more of, well, the thinker; the more intellectual; the deeper...
Again, if you read Westley's comments...
Well, I'm not cutting myself, I still think, in fact, that that's a stupid idea, though I can understand masochism to an extent, and I'm not crying like a bitch, and I don't wear eye makeup, and I wear gray with black, so...
I dunno, I came upon this within me, and I felt like posting it, so...

is not fun.
Just thought I should get that message out there.

...for...those of you who were planning to have one...
